snippet: The humanitarian group condemned a “violent intrusion” that it said had been conducted by Afghan military commandos in Kunduz.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders reports that Afghan military commandos raided and searched one of its main trauma hospitals in country's northeast and calls raid breach of Geneva Conventions; Afghan officials deny Afghan military's involvement.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and AHMAD SHAKIB

lead_paragraph: The humanitarian group condemned a “violent intrusion” that it said had been conducted by Afghan military commandos in Kunduz.

headline.main: Doctors Without Borders Hospital Raided in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Commandos Raid an Afghan Hospital Operated by Doctors Without Borders
